Articles.Content:
So I have a new contract where I have to build a Mun base and have at least 2000 liquid fuel... I was wondering if I could just take 3 of the rockomax x200-8 tanks which have 360 liquid and 440 oxidiser to begin with and just fill it all with liquid fuel on my next Mun stop?

So the question is, Can I fill a tank with only liquid or oxidiser if I so wish?
Yes you can fill it with only LF but only the specified amount, ie: if your tank is 360 LF and 440 Ox, then you can only fill 360 LF, not more.
ah bugga... thanks for the answer. I was hoping to save dragging a big ass tank up there...

Why not use a Mk3 tank, which only holds LF to begin with? Makes for a more compact rocket.

The big question is, whether it's cheaper to fly the fuel out from the ground on Kerbin or fly out a drill and ISRU to make the fuel once you get there?

I dont have the tech for either a MK3 or a drill yet... And since this contract pays a lot im trying to do it one launch ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).
I have a similar contract but it is to set up a Munar space station with 6,000 fuel on hand. This is going to take multiple trips.
with the thing Im building and the amount of time it is taking to get this bloody station into orbit..... Maybe I should just go for several stages...

Damn.... All this work for nothing... But I learned a lot. Like having an assymetrical mun station with its center of mass way off is really really really impossible to land...

Invader Jim any hints on how to get a connected base down to the ground? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). Or do you just land seperated modules? Does that still count in that contract?
